thread.title: Ch'áak' (Eagle) Kootéeyaa

title: Ch'áak' (Eagle) Kootéeyaa
text:
Juneau in Juneau Borough, Alaska — Northwest (North America)
Ch'áak' (Eagle) Kootéeyaa
Kootéeyaa Deiyí • Totem Pole Trail
[Totem pole effigies, top to bottom]
• EAGLE
• WOLF
• KILLER WHALE
• THUNDERBIRD
• BROWN BEAR
The Raven and Eagle totem poles honor the Raven and Eagle clans that once were present among our Tlingit, Haida, and Tsimshian cultures. They include the crests used by clans of both moieties.
The diseases brought by Westerners in the 1800s significantly impacted Native communities and the Native population. The population was reduced by nearly 50 percent and a number of villages were abandoned. Some clans became extinct or were severely diminished in numbers and never fully recovered.
These totem poles are dedicated to those Raven and Eagle clans and to the ancestors of these clans.
TOTEM POLE DESIGNS
Totem pole designs represent clan crests, and they are their most important symbols of their history and identity. They were acquired by ancestors in the ancient past and represent crucial encounters with animal persons and spiritual beings. Other significant recent events in clan histories are also memorialized in crests.
CARVER
Tommy Joseph, Tlingit Master Artist, Sitka
Apprentices: Kristina M. Cranston, Will Peterson
To learn more about this kootéeyaa (totem pole)
scan the QR code with your mobile device.
Erected by Sealaska Heritage Institute and the Mellon Foundation.
Topics. This historical marker is listed in these topic lists:
[Animals](Results.asp?Search=Topic&CategoryID=52)•

[Native Americans](Results.asp?Search=Topic&CategoryID=2).
Location. 58° 17.981′ N, 134° 24.426′ W. Marker is in Juneau, Alaska, in Juneau Borough. Marker is at the intersection of Marine Way (Alaska Route 7) and Seward Street, on the right when traveling west on Marine Way.
[Touch for map](map.asp?markers=258001,257997,181846,181843,181821,181803,181802,181794,181792). Marker is at or near this postal address: One Sealaska Plaza, Juneau AK 99801, United States of America.
Touch for directions.
